docs.title: Diety
docs.text:
The Martyred Saint, The One Who Endures, is the embodiment of seven angelic faces to her faithful:

  • Healing
  • Protection
  • Wisdom
  • Judgement
  • Battle
  • Death
  • Vengeance

She represents:

  • Mercy for the oppressed.
  • Wrath against slavery of body, mind, or soul, whether of the living or the dead.
  • The sanctity of suffering and is petitioned by such.

She has a favored group, a chosen people, the followers of the Martyred Saint.

docs.title: Symbols
docs.text: Her symbols are a sunrise or a pair of bound clasped hands. She manifests to her followers as an angelic being of silver light and a horrific skeletal visage of armor-clad wrath to her enemies.

docs.title: Playbooks
docs.text:
The Martyred Saint has multiple personas manifest in her different chosen followers:

  • Healing, Protection, and Wisdom through her Disciples
  • Judgement through her Monks
  • Battle through her Templars
  • Death through her Incarnations
  • Vengeance through her Undying

Each class playbook has different abilities and skill sets to further the tenets of their Saint in each of her aspects. All, however, are united in their faith in the Saint.

docs.title: Disciples
docs.text:
You have been imbued with divine abilities to reward your faith in the Martyred Saint—The One Who Endures. These abilities take the form of divine spells.

Your path in life is to face danger head-on and defy it. What better way to show your virtue to the Martyred Saint and her teachings than to suffer and spread her miracles?

docs.title: Stats
docs.text: Stat Value Base damage d6 Load 9+STR Maximum HP 8+Constitution

docs.title: Diety
docs.text:
You serve and worship the Martyred Saint. She speaks to and through you. She represents:

  • Mercy for the oppressed.
  • Wrath against slavery of body, mind, or soul, whether of the living or the dead.
  • The sanctity of suffering and is petitioned by such.

The Martyred Saint has multiple personas manifest in different situations: Battle through her Templars; Judgement through her Monks; Death through her Incarnations; Vengence through her Undying; And Healing, Protection, and Wisdom through you, her Disciple.

She has a favored group, a chosen people, the followers of the Saint.

docs.title: Heritage
docs.text: Heritage Move Dwarf Choose one:<ul><li>When you suffer a debility, you may take an additional d4 damage (ignores armor) and gain +1 forward.<li>You are one with stone. When you commune, you are also granted a particular version of the level five spell Words of the Unspeaking as a rote that works only on stone. Elf Choose one:<ul><li>You are always graceful, even in suffering. When you take a debility to DEX, you suffer a -1 penalty to another stat of your choice, but never to DEX.<li>You know what patience is. For you, non-violent protest counts as making camp and recovering, even under harsh conditions. Halfling Choose one:<ul><li>You sing the Healing Songs of Spring and Brook. When you make camp, you and your allies heal +d6.<li>When you take a debility, you gain +DEX armor. Human Choose one:<ul><li>When you pray for guidance, even for a moment, if you ask, “What here is antithetical to the Martyred Saint?” the GM will tell you, honestly.<li>You can have two debilities affecting your WIS score. Each gives you a -1 penalty, and having both gives you a -2 penalty. This brings your maximum number of debilities up to seven.

docs.title: Drives
docs.text:
• Bring the benefits of the Saint to people of a different faith.
  • Defend others who share your faith.
  • Discredit a dangerous misconception about your sphere influence.
  • Disrupt the workings of authorities who do not share your faith.
  • Sacrifice something to your sphere of influence instead of accepting personal gain.

docs.title: Gear
docs.text:
You have clothes appropriate to your calling, dungeon rations (5 uses, 1 weight), and an item that symbolizes your devotion to the Martyred Saint (0 weight, describe it), and choose one:

  • Adventuring gear (5 uses, 1 weight)
  • Bandages (3 uses, slow) and a healing potion
  • Staff (close, two-handed, 1 weight)

docs.title: Starting Moves
docs.text: Move Description Blessed You are devoted to the Martyred Saint. She fills your life with purpose, your soul with enthusiasm, and your limbs with strength.Your Devotion to the Martyred Saint gives you a unique insight and the ability to cast spells in the following spheres of her divine power:<ul><li>Healing<li>Protection<li>WisdomAlso, as a disciple of the Martyred Saint, you live by a set of codes, strictures, or tenets, things you are supposed to do, and some things you are forbidden to do.At a minimum, the Saint’s teachings demand the following personal code:<ul><li>Must ease suffering whenever you can.<li>Forbidden from wearing armor.<li>Harming others requires penance: fasting or self-flagellation.You can further define your code during play. Cast a Divine Spell When you unleash a spell granted to you by your devotion, roll+WIS.<ul><li>On a 10+, the spell is successfully cast, and your devotion does not revoke it; you may cast it again.<li>On a 7-9, the spell is cast, but choose one:<ul><li>After you cast it, the spell is revoked. You can only cast the spell again once you Commune and have it granted to you.<li>You draw unwelcome attention or put yourself in a spot. The GM will tell you how.<li>Your casting strains your devotion—take -1 ongoing to cast a spell until the next time you commune.Note: Maintaining spells with ongoing effects will sometimes cause a penalty to your roll to cast a spell. Commune When you spend uninterrupted time in quiet contemplation of your devotion (an hour or so), you:<ul><li>Lose any spells already granted to you.<li>Are granted new spells of your choice whose total levels don’t exceed your level+1, none of which is higher than your level.<li>Prepare all of your rotes, which never count against your limit.Your spheres of divine insight determine which spells you can cast. See the following Spells section. You cannot be granted spells from other divine spheres or classes. Sacrifice When you touch someone and make a demand of them, if they do what you ask, take an attribute debility of your choice and choose one:<ul><li>They are healed for half your current HP.<li>They are healed of one debility.<li>They are healed of one injury (like a broken arm).<li>They gain d8 temporary HP. Damage reduced the temporary HP first, but it cannot be healed.You must ask for something immediate, not long-term, and if you already have all six debilities, you cannot heal them. Unbowed, Unbent, Unbroken When you prepare yourself to endure some hardship without fighting back, roll+CON.<ul><li>On a hit, you can take half damage or completely ignore another ill effect.<li>On a 10+, you can defeat, expose, or frustrate your oppressor with your stubbornness.

docs.title: Advanced Moves
docs.text: Move Description By Nature Sustained You don’t need to eat or drink. If a move tells you to mark off a ration, ignore it. Chosen One Requires: Cast a Divine SpellChoose one spell. You are granted that spell as if it was one level lower. Devoted Healer When you heal someone else of damage, add your level to the amount of damage healed. Divine Protection When you wear no armor or shield, you have 2 armor. Empower Requires Cast a Divine SpellWhen you cast a spell, on a 10+, you can choose from the 7-9 list. If you do, you may also choose one of these effects:<ul><li>The spell’s effects are doubled.<li>The spell’s targets are doubled. First Aid Requires Cast a Divine SpellCure Light Wounds is a rote for you and therefore doesn’t count against your limit of granted spells. Iron Will When you are subject to mind control or magic that influences your feelings, you may choose to take d4 damage (ignores armor) and ignore the influence. Penitent When you take damage and embrace the pain, you may take +d4 damage (ignores armor). If you do, take +1 forward. Serenity You ignore -1 on casting for your first ongoing spell. Stigmata When you display your bleeding, take d4 damage (ignores armor) and choose one person who can see. They heal 2d8 damage. Your wounds leave bloody stains that do not come out until the damage caused by their infliction is healed.

docs.title: Master Moves
docs.text: Move Description Anointed Requires Chosen One Choose one spell in addition to the one you picked for the chosen one. You are granted that spell as if it was one level lower. Caretaker’s Insight When you Discern Realities, if you study someone who is afflicted, injured, or in pain, you may ask questions from this list instead:<ul><li>What do you hope for the future?<li>What do you intend to do now?<li>What do you want from me?<li>What makes you feel beautiful or loved?<li>What’s wrong with you, and how could I help you?When you heal someone, also ask one of these questions. Divine Armor Replaces Divine ProtectionWhen you wear no armor or shield, you have 3 armor. Greater Empower Replaces EmpowerWhen you cast a spell, on a 10-11, you can choose from the 7-9 list. If you do, you may choose one of these effects as well. On a 12+, you can choose one of these effects for free.<ul><li>The spell’s effects are doubled.<li>The spell’s targets are doubled. Greater First Aid Requires First AidCure Moderate Wounds is a rote for you and therefore doesn’t count against your limit of granted spells. Greater Stigmata Replaces StigmataWhen you display your bleeding, take d4 damage (ignores armor) and choose one person who can see. They heal 2d8 damage and all your other allies who can see you heal d8 damage each. Your wounds leave bloody stains that do not come out until the damage caused by their infliction is healed. Healthy Distrust Whenever the unclean magic wielded by mortals causes you to Defy Danger, treat a miss as a 7-9 instead. Martyr Replaces PenitentWhen you take damage and embrace the pain, you may take +d4 damage (ignoring armor). If you do, gain +1 forward and add your level to any damage done or healed by your following action. Providence Requires SerenityYou ignore -1 on casting for two ongoing spells.

docs.title: Spells
docs.text:
Your faith in the Martyred Saint grants you spells in three of her divine spheres: healing, protection, and wisdom.

Level Spell Description 0 Endure OngoingAs long as this spell is ongoing, you or an ally you touch can endure extreme heat or cold, like walking across burning sands or swimming through arctic waters. While this spell is ongoing, take a -1 to cast a spell. 0 Guidance The symbol of your deity appears before you and gestures towards the direction or course of action your deity would have you take, then disappears. The message is through gesture only; your communication through this spell is severely limited. 0 Sanctify Your deity consecrates the food or water you hold in your hands while you cast this spell. In addition to being holy or unholy, the affected substance is purified of any mundane spoilage. 1 Cure Light Wounds At your touch, wounds mend, and bones cease to ache. Heal an ally you touch of d8 damage. 1 Detect Alignment When you cast this spell, choose an alignment: Follower of the Saint, Neutral to the Saint, Antithetical to the Saint. One of your senses is briefly able to detect that alignment. The GM will tell you what there is of that alignment. 1 Invigorate One ally you touch is cured of fainting, lethargy, paralysis, or unconsciousness, and you can instantly move again. 1 Mending Your devotion allows you to fix some mundane object without needing tools or expertise. 1 Planning OngoingCast this spell when you devise a plan to approach a situation. When you carry out that plan, gain +1 forward. You can only have a heightened understanding of one plan at a time. 1 Sanctuary As you cast this spell, you walk the perimeter of an area, consecrating it to your deity. As long as you stay within that area, you are alerted whenever someone acts maliciously in the sanctuary (including entering with harmful intent). Anyone who receives healing within a sanctuary heals +d4 HP. 1 Ward of Protection By drawing a simple glyph on one of your possessions, you will always know if and when it is taken from you and generally where it is located if that should happen. You may only have one Ward active at a time. 3 Analgesia OngoingYou touch an ally for a second, and they are cured of all fear, nausea, and pain, whether mundane or magical. While this spell is ongoing, you take a -1 to cast a spell. 3 Cure Moderate Wounds You staunch bleeding and set bones through magic. Heal an ally you touch of 2d8 damage. 3 Immunity OngoingName one specific source of harm, such as burning, cutting, lightning, or poisonous gas. While this spell is ongoing, you are immune to harm from that source and take a -1 to cast a spell. You may still be subject to secondary effects—a fire that does not burn you produces smoke that can still choke you, and drowning is uncomfortable. 3 Inquiry Cast this spell on a person you can see and ask one question about them from the list below:
  • What does this person intend to do?
  • What does this person need or desire?
  • What is false about this person?
  • Who does this person associate with?Gain +1 forward when you act on the answer. 3 Silence OngoingName a location you can see. While this spell is ongoing, no sound can be made in that place, and you take a -1 to cast a spell (assuming the Silence does not prevent spell casting outright). 3 Local Customs OngoingThe customs of the people you observe are revealed to you. While this spell is ongoing, you take a -1 to cast a spell, and you can determine and mimic local customs wherever you are. You can tell if someone’s behavior is routine or unexpected by observers, and you can predict what kind of behavior is expected of you. Still, you do not gain any additional language skills. While this spell is ongoing, take a -1 to cast a spell. 5 Circle of Protection OngoingDraw a circle on the ground around you or someone else. Until that person leaves the circle’s confines, no extra-planar entity can cross or extend its influence beyond it. While this spell is ongoing, take a -1 to cast a spell. 5 Cure Critical Wounds Heal an ally you touch of 3d8 damage. 5 Reverse Poison With a touch, you cure an ally of any ill effects caused by a poisonous substance, short of death itself. Damage inflicted by the poison itself is healed, but the damage caused by other sources enhanced by the poison remains. 5 True Seeing OngoingYour vision is open to the true nature of everything you focus on. You pierce illusions and see things that have been hidden. The GM will describe the area before you ignore any illusions and falsehoods, magical or otherwise. While this spell is ongoing, you take a -1 to cast a spell. 5 Words of the Unspeaking You speak to the spirits within things with a touch. The non-living object you touch answers three questions you pose as best it can. 7 Heal Touch an ally, and you may heal them of damage by as many points equal to your maximum HP. 7 True Discernment When you cast this spell on the evidence left by some creature or event or something removed from far away, you may study it as if you had discerned realities and rolled 10+. 7 Word of Recall Choose a word. After casting this spell, when you speak the chosen word, you and any allies touching you when you first cast the spell are immediately returned to where you cast the spell. You can only maintain a single location; casting Word of Recall again before speaking the word replaces the earlier spell. 9 Divine Presence OngoingEvery creature must ask your leave to enter your presence, and you must give permission aloud for them to enter. Any creature without your leave takes an extra d10 damage whenever they take damage in your presence. While this spell is ongoing, you take a -1 to cast a spell. 9 Questing Describe an objective, however complicated. The GM will tell you what it would take to accomplish typically. You can choose one of those requirements, and the GM will tell you a more straightforward—and possible—way to achieve it. 9 Repair Choose one event in the target’s past. All effects of that event, including damage, poison, disease, and magical effects, are ended and repaired. HP and diseases are healed, poisons are neutralized, and magical effects are ended.

docs.title: Incarnations
docs.text: You are a living reincarnation of the Martyred Saint—The One Who Endures. You continue her quest to rid the world of necromancy and foul sorcery.

docs.title: Stats
docs.text: Stat Value Base damage d6 Load 10+STR Maximum HP 8+Constitution

docs.title: Diety
docs.text:
You serve and worship the Martyred Saint. She speaks to and through you. She represents:

  • Mercy for the oppressed.
  • Wrath against slavery of body, mind, or soul, whether of the living or the dead.
  • The sanctity of suffering and is petitioned by such.

The Martyred Saint has multiple personas manifest in different situations: Battle through her Templars; Healing, Protection, and Wisdom through her Disciples; Judgement through her Monks; Vengence through her Undying; And Death through you, her Incarnation.

She has a favored group, a chosen people, the followers of the Saint.

docs.title: Heritage
docs.text: Heritage Move Dwarf Choose one:<ul><li>When you deal damage to the undead, deal +1d4 damage.<li>When you swear an oath according to the precepts of your faith, take +1 forward to accomplish it. If you fail to do so, or turn away from your oath (to swear another one, for example), take -1 forward. Elf Choose one:<ul><li>When you Discern Reality, on a hit, your keen senses also tell you if there are any spirits, ghosts, undead, or extra-planar entities here.<li>Gain +1 forward after meditating for a day. Halfling Choose one:<ul><li>When you Spout Lore concerning the domain of death or necromancy, take +1 forward.<li>You sing the healing songs of spring and brook. When you make camp, you and your allies heal +d6. Human Choose one:<ul><li>When you touch someone, you can always tell if they are possessed, and if so, by what.<li>When you turn the undead, you may ask one question about them, as if you had Discerned Reality and rolled a 7-9.

docs.title: Drives
docs.text:
• Bring the benefits of your deity to people of a different faith.
  • Endanger yourself to follow the precepts you are devoted to.
  • Punish a necromancer or summoner of spirits for their misdeeds.
  • Free someone from a troublesome spirit.

docs.title: Gear
docs.text:
You have clothes appropriate to your calling and present situation, dungeon rations (5 uses, 1 weight), and an item that symbolizes your devotion (0 weight, describe it). Choose two:

  • Adventuring gear (5 uses, 1 weight).
  • Bag of books (5 uses, 2 weight).
  • Bandages (3 uses, slow) and a healing potion.
  • Chainmail (1 armor, 1 weight).
  • Mace or warhammer (close, 1 weight).
  • Shield (+1 armor, 2 weight).
  • Staff (close, two-handed, 1 weight).

docs.title: Starting Moves
docs.text: Move Description Circle of Protection When you draw a magical circle on the ground, roll +WIS.<ul><li>On a 10+, it will keep spirits, ghosts, or extra-planar entities in or out until someone else breaks it.<li>On a 7-9, it will keep them in or out momentarily, but only briefly. Divine Guidance When you petition your deity according to the precepts of your Martyred Saint, you are granted some helpful knowledge or boon related to your deity’s domain. The GM will tell you what. Ghost Seer When you invoke your faith by prayer, you can interact with ghostly, insubstantial, or extra-planar entities, including damaging them if your faith opposes them. However, you can’t deal with the entity separately if they possess someone. A Helping Hand When you arrive at a new settlement, followers of the Martyred Saint will accept you as their honored guest and provide you with friendship, hospitality, and advice. If you also agree to help them solve a problem they have, gain +1 forward. Turn Undead When you hold your holy symbol aloft and call on your devotion for protection, roll +WIS.<ul><li>On a hit, so long as you continue to pray and brandish your holy symbol, no undead may come within reach of you.<li>On a 10+, you also momentarily daze intelligent undead and cause mindless undead to flee.Aggression breaks the effects, and they can act as expected. Intelligent undead may still find ways to harry you from afar.

docs.title: Advanced Moves
docs.text: Move Description Abjuration When you banish a creature from another plane of existence, roll +INT.<ul><li>On a 10+, it may not approach you further; if it lacks an anchor in this world, it must return to whence it came.<li>On a 7-9, it may only approach you further if you allow it to (or let your guard down).<li>On a miss, you cannot banish it. Ashes to Ashes Requires Turn UndeadThe first time you brandish your holy symbol at an undead creature, deal your damage to it (ignores armor). Divine Intervention Requires Commune or Divine GuidanceWhen you petition the Martyred Saint, suffer a debility, and you gain one protection. Lose any protection you already held from this move. Spend that protection when you or an ally take damage to call on your deity, who intervenes with an appropriate manifestation and negates the damage. Ghost Killer When you attack a spirit, ghost, or extra-planar entity, your damage die is a d10. Ghost Talker You can see and interact with all ghosts and spirits of the dead and peer into the spiritual workings of the undead, even if they are mindless. When studying an undead creature, ask whatever questions you like from the Discern Reality list. Heaven’s Weaving When you Parley* with a character, your faith grants you insight into them. Ask their player two questions from the *Discern Reality list. Orison for Guidance Requires Personal DeityWhen you sacrifice something of value to your deity and pray for guidance, your deity tells you what it would have you do. If you do it, mark XP. Spiritual Connection If you have an item from someone that they highly value, you can interact with them as if they were a spirit, ghost, or extra-planar entity and use moves against them. The Scales of Life and Death When someone takes their last breath in your presence, they take +1 to their roll. To Know the Unknowable When you encounter a creature, manifestation, or power from another plane of existence, you can ask the GM from whence it came and what its properties are. Take +1 forward when acting on the answers.

docs.title: Master Moves
docs.text: Move Description Armor of Faith Requires Turn UndeadWhile turning undead, you and nearby allies are protected, gaining +2 armor. This bonus lasts only as long as there are undead present. Ars Goetia When you first encounter an extra-planar entity, you may ask the GM any one question. The GM will answer truthfully. Funerary Rites When you take time after a battle to dedicate your victory to the Martyred Saint’s ideals and bury the dead, take +1 forward. Cheat Death Again When you have zero HP, rather than taking your last breath, roll +WIS.<ul><li>On a 10+, you live and choose one:<ul><li>You discover one of Death’s dark secrets.<li>You have a moment with a soul that has already passed on.<li>You manage to avoid Death’s notice.<li>On a 7-9, you live, but Death takes notice. You discover something terrible.<li>On a miss, you can cheat death no longer, and you must pass through the Black Gate. Closing the Gateway When you attack a spirit, ghost, or extra-planar entity, you deal +d6 damage, and your foe can choose to return from whence it came instead of taking damage.When you reduce a spirit, ghost, or extra-planar creature to zero HP, its soul is subsequently barred from appearing on the material plane in any form. It can still be encountered in astral visions and other planes, but not in your world. Command of Injunction When you command someone in your presence to cease a specific activity, roll +WIS.<ul><li>On a 10+, they must comply to the best of their ability.<li>On a 7-9, they must comply until you leave their presence.Only one injunction you issue can stand at any time. Only activities consciously undertaken can be subject to injunction. Divine Invincibility Replaces Divine InterventionWhen you petition your deity, suffer a debility, and you gain 2 protection. Lose any protection you already held. Spend one protection when you or an ally takes damage to call on your deity, who intervenes with an appropriate manifestation and negates the damage. Dust to Dust Requires Ashes to AshesWhen you reduce a creature to zero HP, its soul is put to rest and cannot be raised again as an undead creature. Evidence of Faith When you see divine magic as it happens, you can ask the GM which deity granted the spell and its effects. Take +1 forward when acting on the answers.

docs.title: Monks
docs.text: You are a fighter, but you fight with honor. For the followers of the Martyred Saint, you embody lawful Judgement. This is what you live and breathe as you wander, righting wrongs. In this domain, you work miracles.

docs.title: Stats
docs.text: Stat Value Base damage d6 Load 9+STR Maximum HP 8+Constitution

docs.title: Diety
docs.text:
You serve and worship the Martyred Saint. She speaks to and through you. She represents:

  • Mercy for the oppressed.
  • Wrath against slavery of body, mind, or soul, whether of the living or the dead.
  • The sanctity of suffering and is petitioned by such.

The Martyred Saint has multiple personas manifest in different situations: Battle through her Templars; Healing, Protection, and Wisdom through her Disciples; Death through her Incarnations; Vengence through her Undying; And Judgement through you, her Monk.

She has a favored group, a chosen people, the followers of the Saint.

docs.title: Heritage
docs.text: Heritage Move Dwarf As long as you have Chi left, you cannot be pushed, thrown, tripped, or knocked over. Elf As long as you have Chi left, you may defend with DEX instead of CON and hack and slash with DEX instead of STR. Halfling When you fight with honor, add this to the deeds you can spend a Chi to perform—Dodge a blow meant for you. Human When you arrive at a new settlement, followers of the Martyred Saint will accept you as their guest and provide you with friendship, hospitality, and advice. If you also agree to help them solve a problem they have, gain +1 forward.

docs.title: Drives
docs.text:
• Advance the interests of the Martyred Saint.
  • Bring a villain to justice.
  • Choose honor over personal gain.
  • Fulfill a promise to protect someone during a dangerous journey or situation.
  • Ignore danger to aid another.

docs.title: Gear
docs.text:
You have a token of membership in your honorable fighting society, such as a robe, sash, or scroll. Describe it.

You have clothes appropriate to your calling and present situation, dungeon rations (5 uses, 1 weight), and choose one:

  • Adventuring gear (5 uses, 1 weight)
  • Bandages (3 uses, slow) and a healing potion

docs.title: Starting Moves
docs.text: Move Description Fight with Honour When you enter a fight, roll +CON.<ul><li>On a 10+, hold 3 Chi.<li>On a 7-9, hold 2 Chi.<li>On a miss, hold 1 Chi anyway, but your enemies already have the drop on you.Spend a Chi during the fight to achieve one of the following effects:<ul><li>Block a blow meant for you or someone else (you take half damage).<li>Break free from bonds or other confinement.<li>Cross the distance between yourself and a foe, bypassing all obstacles.<li>Deal your damage to a foe within reach.<li>Leap over or across a physical obstacle.You lose any remaining Chi once the fight is over. Fists of Fury You are never unarmed—your body and limbs are a weapon, just as good as any other. Invoke a Miracle Your faith and discipline to the teachings of the Martyred Saint allow you to invoke any miracle from her divine sphere of Judgment that does not exceed your level.When you invoke a judgment miracle, roll +WIS.<ul><li>On a 10+, you cast the spell but choose one consequence from the list below.<ul><li>The spell’s effect is doubled, but you may not invoke this miracle again until you sleep for a night.<li>The spell’s targets are doubled, but you may not invoke this miracle again until after a night’s sleep.<li>The miracle has its typical results.<ul><li>On a 7-9, you cast the miracle, but choose one:<ul><li>You may only cast this spell again after you sleep for a night.<li>Your spellcasting is obvious; you draw attention to yourself.

docs.title: Advanced Moves
docs.text: Move Description Arrows in Hand Requires Fists of FuryWhen you block or dodge a missile attack, roll+DEX.<ul><li>On a 10+, you snatch the missile out of the air, and it deals no damage.<ul><li>On a 7-9, choose one:<ul><li>You avoid the attack completely.<li>You snatch the missile from the air and take half the damage. Fuelled by Honour Requires Fight with HonourIf you accomplish your drive during a fight, gain one Chi, up to a maximum of three. Hand of the Monkey Requires Fists of FuryIf you are unarmoured and carry no shield, you have 2 armor against hand-held weapons. If this reduces the damage you take to zero, you may also disarm your foe. Honourable Society You are a respected member of an honorable fighting society. When you send word to them for aid, you may recruit as if you have a good reputation and are paying generously, even though you are not paying at all. Any hirelings they send to you have at least loyalty +1 and warrior +1. Light as a Feather When you run across a surface that cannot hold your weight, roll +DEX. On a 10+, you do it gracefully and without trouble. On a 7-9, you make it across, but with consequences. The GM will tell you what.

docs.title: Master Moves
docs.text: Move Description Glorious Honour Requires Fight with HonourWhen you fight with honor, hold an extra Chi, even on a miss. Hand of the Monkey King Replaces Hand of the MonkeyIf you are unarmoured and carry no shield, you have 4 armor against hand-held weapons.If this reduces the damage you take to zero, you may also disarm your foe. Superior Technique Requires Fight with HonourAdd these to the list of deeds you can spend a chi to perform:<ul><li>Break through a physical obstacle.<li>Deal your damage to a foe within sight.<li>Grab an item within reach. Now it is yours. Exacting Discipline When you invoke a miracle, on 12+, you can double the spell’s effect or the number of targets without losing the spell.

docs.title: Judgement Miracles
docs.text: Level Spell Description 0 Contract When you sign a contract that you have cast this spell upon, you are mystically notified if the other party breaks it. 1 Casting Stones OngoingAs long as you concentrate on Judgment, any stone you pick up becomes a powerful weapon (thrown, near, 1 piercing). While this spell is ongoing, you take a -1 to cast a spell. 1 Cause Fear OngoingChoose a target you can see and a nearby object. The target is afraid of the object so long as you maintain the spell. The target’s reaction is up to the GM: flee, panic, beg, fight. While this spell is ongoing, you take a -1 to cast a spell. You cannot target entities with less than animal intelligence (magical constructs, undead, automatons, and the like). 3 Dispel Magic Choose a spell or magical effect in your presence; this spell rips it apart. Lesser spells are ended, and powerful magic is reduced or dampened as long as you are nearby. 3 Hold Person OngoingChoose a person you can see. They can only act if you cast a spell or leave their presence. This effect ends immediately if the target takes damage from any source. 5 Contagion OngoingChoose a creature you can see. Until you end this spell, the target suffers from a disease of your choice. While this spell is ongoing, you take a -1 to cast a spell. 7 Harm Touch an enemy and strike them with divine wrath—deal 2d8 damage and d6 damage to yourself. This damage ignores armor. 9 Plague OngoingName a city, town, encampment, or other place people live. As long as this spell is active, that place is beset by a plague appropriate to your deity’s domains (locusts, death of the firstborn, etc.). While this spell is ongoing, you take a -1 to cast a spell.

docs.title: Templars
docs.text:
Your Martyred Saint called on you for a reason. You hear her voice in your dreams and see her in the eyes of the faithless. You sense her guiding hand when your enemies loom.

They brand you with false names: fiend, inquisitor, zealot. These insults are not who you are. You are a Templar of the Martyred Saint. One who endures in her name.

Your will is iron, your cause just, and your foes doomed.

docs.title: Stats
docs.text: Stat Value Base Damage d8 Load 10+STR Maximum HP 10+Constitution

docs.title: Diety
docs.text:
You serve and worship the Martyred Saint. She speaks to and through you. She represents:

  • Mercy for the oppressed.
  • Wrath against slavery of body, mind, or soul, whether of the living or the dead.
  • The sanctity of suffering and is petitioned by such.

The Martyred Saint has multiple personas manifest in different situations: Healing, Protection, and Wisdom through her Disciples; Judgement through her Monks; Death through her Incarnations. Vengence through her Undying; And Battle through you, her Templar.

She has a favored group, a chosen people, the followers of the Saint.

docs.title: Heritage
docs.text: Heritage Move Dwarf Choose one:<ul><li>When you roll for I Am the Law, on a hit, you also gain +d4 damage forward against those you are ordering around.<li>When you take the damage meant for someone else, you gain +1 armor. Elf Choose one:<ul><li>Choose one weapon—you can always treat weapons of that type as if they had the precise tag.<li>When you Discern Reality while protecting someone, you can also ask, “How can I get my ward out of here?” Halfling Choose one:<ul><li>When you attack with a ranged weapon, deal +2 damage.<li>When you Defy Danger and use your small size to your advantage, gain +1. Human Choose one:<ul><li>When you pray for guidance, even for a moment, and ask, “What here is antithetical to the Martyred Saint?” the GM will tell you.<li>When your flock or hirelings helps you fight, you deal +d4 damage.

docs.title: Drives
docs.text:
• Deny mercy to a criminal or unbeliever.
  • Endanger yourself to combat an unnatural threat.
  • Endanger yourself to protect someone weaker than you.

docs.title: Gear
docs.text:
You start with all the following:

  • A symbol of the Martyred Saint (0 weight, describe it)
  • Dungeon Rations (5 uses, 1 weight)
  • Adventuring Gear (5 uses, 1 weight)
  • A longsword, axe, or mace (close, 1 weight)
  • A tabard (+1 armor, 1 weight)

You also start with one of the following:

  • A greatsword, maul, or executioner’s axe (reach, +1 damage, two-handed, 2 weight)
  • A crossbow (near, far, 2 weight)

Finally, choose one:

  • Armoured Breastplate (+1 armor, clumsy, 1 weight)
  • Poultices and herbs (2 uses, slow, 1 weight) and antitoxin

docs.title: Starting Moves
docs.text: Move Description Battle Miracles At the start of a session or when you eliminate a powerful enemy antithetical to the Martyred Saint, gain one of the following miracles of the Martyred Saint:<ul><li>Bless<li>Magic Weapon<li>Wisdom of WarWhen you invoke the power of this miracle, roll +WIS.<ul><li>On a 7+, the miracle manifests, but you can’t invoke the miracle again until after you sleep for a night.<li>On a 10+, the miracle’s power is retained, and you may invoke it again. Law When you give an NPC an order based on your divine authority, roll +CHA.<ul><li>On a 7+, they choose one:<ul><li>Do what you say<li>Back away cautiously, then flee<li>Attack you<li>On a 10+, you also gain +1 forward against them.<li>On a miss, they do as they please, and you suffer -1 forward against them. Squire You have an apprentice templar. Name and describe them. Your squire’s skill for all their abilities equals a third of your level (rounding up.)They start with the following abilities:<ul><li>Intervene: When your squire defies danger alongside you, you may roll +skill instead. If you do, the squire takes the brunt of any consequences.<li>Ministry: When you make camp with your squire, if you would heal, you also recover +skill HP.During a session, the GM may ask what lessons you’ve taught your squire about the faith. If you answer, mark XP.

docs.title: Advanced Moves
docs.text: Move Description Authority Gain +1 to order hirelings. Behold When you invoke your miracles in battle, you gain +1 to the roll. Bound When you and your squire deal damage together, add 2x skill to the damage. If there are consequences to your actions, you and the squire share them. Charge! When you lead the charge into combat, those you lead gain +1 forward. Command When you command a group of willing NPCs to do something, they do it, but the GM picks one or more from the following:<ul><li>It’ll take days/weeks/months to complete<li>The flock will question their faith, or yours<li>Doing so will leave _____ vulnerable<li>It will cost you _____ <li>First, you must _____ <li>You’ll need help from _____ <li>You must first defeat _____ <li>The best they can manage is a lesser version Protector When you defend the unarmed or defenseless, gain a +1 hold, even on a miss.

docs.title: Master Moves
docs.text: Move Description Crusader Requires CommandWhen you Lead the Flock in a battle against enemies of the Martyred Saint, they will always give their all for the cause. The GM may not choose “the flock will question their faith” or “the best they can manage is a lesser version.” High Warden Replaces ProtectorWhen you defend, you always gain a +1 hold, even on a miss. When you get a 12+ to defend, the nearest creature is distracted or momentarily stunned, granting you a clear opportunity. Divine Authority Replaces AuthorityGain +1 ongoing when ordering hirelings. When you roll a 12+, the hireling transcends their moment of fear and doubt and carries out your order with particular effectiveness or efficiency. Greater Battle Miracles Requires Battle MiraclesAdd the following Battle Miracles to your list.<ul><li>Fireball<li>Immunity Onward Replaces Charge!When you lead the charge into combat, those you lead gain +1 forward and +2 armor forward.

docs.title: Battle Miracles
docs.text: Miracle Description Bless OngoingThe Martyred Saint smiles on you or an ally of your choice. Gain +1 ongoing so long as the battle and spell continue. While this spell is ongoing, you take -1 to cast another spell. Fireball You evoke a mighty flame that envelops your target and everyone nearby, inflicting 2d6 damage that ignores armor. Immunity OngoingName one specific source of harm, such as burning, cutting, lightning, or poisonous gas. While this spell is ongoing, you are immune to harm from that source and take -1 to cast another spell. You may still be subject to secondary effects—a fire that does not burn you produces smoke that can still choke you, and drowning is dreadfully uncomfortable. Magic Weapon OngoingThe weapon you hold while casting does +d4 damage until you dismiss this spell. While this spell is ongoing, you take -1 to cast another spell. Wisdom of War When cast during a battle or on the spot of a historical battle, the GM will tell you something interesting and helpful about that battle, as if you were Spouting Lore and rolled a 10+.

docs.title: Undying
docs.text: As a chosen one of the Martyred Saint, a disciple, an incarnation, a monk, or a templar, when you die violently at the hands of Saint’s enemies, you erupt from your shallow grave at sunrise and seek vengeance. You are now a revenant.

docs.title: Stats
docs.text:
Upon your resurrection, you lose your former identity but gain supernatural endurance.

  • Lose one level.
  • Erase your character’s name, bonds, and drives.
  • Lose all your class and heritage moves. You gain new revenant class moves described in the following sections.
  • Add 10 to your maximum HP.
  • Take the first Degradation (see the following section).

docs.title: Drive
docs.text: You now have only one burning desire: Wreaking vengeance upon the enemies of your Martyred Saint.

docs.title: Undying
docs.text:
Your mortal shell has only a tenuous link to your soul.

  • You do not breathe, eat, drink, or sleep.
  • You also do not heal as usual. You gain no benefit from poultices and herbs, bandages, magical healing, make camp, or recovery.
  • You are immune to all effects that turn or control undead.

docs.title: Degradation
docs.text:
When you become a revenant, take the first of the following six degradations. Add the subsequent degradation whenever the result of a move instructs you to do so. Degradations manifest in the order listed, and each is selected only once.

# Degradation Details 1 Strange Appetite Choose one particular type of sustenance:
  • Bone and marrow
  • Brains
  • Hearts
  • Still-warm bloodYou heal a quarter of your HP or remove one debility whenever you consume the sustenance. Your strange appetite is the only way to restore your HP or remove debilities.Whenever you have the opportunity to indulge your strange appetite, you lose all control and immediately begin to gorge, oblivious to your surroundings, unless you succeed in a Defy Danger roll +WIS. 2 Carrion Stench A horrible odor always follows you. Natural beasts shy away from you or become aggressive. 3 Dark Vision You can see even in absolute darkness. Sunlight pains you. You take -1 ongoing in sunlight. 4 Deathly Visage It’s clear to all who look at you that you are dead. When you use intimidation and your sinister appearance to Parley, you gain +1 forward. 5 Home to Vermin Insects have taken up residence in your corpse. These bugs will do favors if you ask. Treat them as Followers (Quality +0, Loyalty +0, 1 HP, meek, stealthy, swarm, tiny). 6 The Final Degradation Your soul’s tenuous link to your mortal shell is severed for eternity. Your body spontaneously turns to ash and blows away on an unfelt breeze. Your soul returns to your Saint. Roll a new character.

docs.title: Starting Moves
docs.text:
Upon becoming a revenant, you gain the following moves.

Move Description Forgotten Former Life Add this question to your Discern Realities list:
  • ”What’s the quickest way to my vengeance?”When you act on the answer, gain +1 forward and mark XP. From the Underworld Returned You bear a mark of your time in the underworld. Choose a part of your body that takes on the visible aspects of death while remaining fully functional:
    • Arm: Any weapon you grasp flows into the underworld. It gains +2 piercing against living creatures.
    • Eye: When you touch a corpse, you see what it saw in its last moments. The GM will describe it.
    • Legs: Your passing leaves no mark or scent as a living person would. Inexorable When you push the limits of your unliving body, choose one of the following outcomes to attempt.
      • Perform a feat of inhuman strength.
      • Move with uncanny speed and grace.
      • Refuse to be moved, restrained, or knocked off your feet.Roll +CON:
        • On a 10+, suffer d4 damage (no armor reduction), and the attempt succeeds.
        • On 7–9, suffer d6 damage (no armor reduction), and the attempt succeeds.
        • On a miss, suffer d8 damage (no armor reduction), the attempt fails, and you suffer any other consequences of your missed roll. Mark of the Undead Dead spirits see your mark and know you as their own. Any dead spirit still clinging to the mortal plane can speak with you. The living, especially the devout, see your mark as a sign of sin. You take a -1 ongoing to CHA rolls with the living who see your mark. Sustained by Rage Neither poison nor disease harms you. You feel no pain. When you take damage from weapons, take half damage (rounded up, after armor reduction).When you are reduced to zero HP, roll +CON.
          • On a 10+, regain half your HP and choose one effect from the following list.
          • On a 7–9, regain a quarter of your HP and choose two effects.
          • On a miss, regain 1 HP, and all three effects apply.Effects
            • Add the next Degradation (see the previous section).
            • You’re out of the action and incapacitated for d6 hours or until sunrise (whichever is shorter).
            • Your body is permanently disfigured in some way. Describe it.Note:
              • If your body is destroyed (for example, burned to ash), treat it as a roll of 6- and your soul lingers incapacitated until your mortal shell reforms with 1 HP at the next sunrise.

docs.title: Advanced Moves
docs.text:
You may pick from the following moves starting at level two. After selecting both moves, you gain no new moves when leveling up until level six.

Move Description Branded Requires From the Underworld ReturnedChoose a second body part to take on the visible aspects of death. Indelible Requires From the Underworld ReturnedThe underworld’s mark grows so that it may not be concealed. Describe it. The dead will seek you out, giving you what aid they can and not harm you. The devout will treat you as a heretic.

docs.title: Master Moves
docs.text:
You may pick from the following moves starting at level six. After selecting both moves, you gain no new moves when leveling up.

Move Description Blemished Requires BrandedChoose a third body part to take on the visible aspects of death. Whispers in the Dark When you speak to a dead spirit, you take +1 forward with all who knew that spirit in life.
